description: ERECTION OF A TWO STOREY SIDE EXTENSION, FIRST FLOOR REAR EXTENSION AND ENTRANCE PORCH. REFACING OF EXISTING FRONT FACADE AND SIDE RETURNS AND ALTERATIONS TO WINDOWS.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: [401_PL_05 Revision A, 401_PL_06 Revision A, 401_PL_00, 401_PL_07, 401_PL_01, 401_PL_02, 401_PL_03, 401_PL_04 ]

Condition : 3 - No development shall take place until details of particulars and samples of the proposed brick and windows  have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval. No works which are the subject of this condition shall be carried out until the details are approved, and the development shall be carried out in full accordance with the
approved details.

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no window, door or other opening other than those expressly authorised by this permission shall be constructed in any elevation without planning permission first being obtained from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 5 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the windows at first floor level in the side elevations shall be glazed with obscured glass and shall be maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 6 - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 7 - No demolition or construction work or ancillary activities such as deliveries shall take place before 8am or after 6pm Mondays - Fridays inclusive, before 8am or after 1pm on Saturdays or at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Condition : 8 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:
   i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
